EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
- Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0) – Smelts iron ore into iron plates.
- Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
- Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) – Extracts iron ore; refueled in Step 64 and now working, though it continues to report a “chest at drop position is full” warning.
- Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) – Transfers ore from the mining drill with its pickup at (-13.5, -49.5) and an intended drop at (-15.5, -49.5).
- Remote Output Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5) – Legacy iron chest repurposed in Step 70 to serve as the output container; currently holds transferred ore (60 units as per the latest update).
- Transport Belt Connection – Established in Step 71 to link the mining drill’s drop area at (-15.5, -49.5) with the Remote Output Chest, replacing the previously used sink chest that was removed to alleviate output blockage.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API and Parameter Handling
  - When calling inspection functions (e.g., inspect_inventory), supply a valid entity object rather than a Position object to avoid attribute errors.
  - Access Position object properties directly instead of invoking them as callable methods.

• Inventory Management and Entity Placement
  - Verify that sufficient inventory is available before attempting to place an entity; errors such as “No iron_chest in inventory” occur when items are missing.
  - Initiate extraction operations only when the container holds a positive quantity to prevent errors like “must be greater than 0.”

• Output Blockage and Sink Chest Handling
  - Regularly clear container inventories or remove and reposition sink chests to resolve persistent “chest full” warnings.
  - Consider replacing sink chests with transport belt connections to maintain uninterrupted ore transfer when output blockage issues arise.

• Entity Alignment and Position Verification
  - Ensure that inserter pickup and drop positions are correctly aligned with their corresponding entities to prevent transfer mismatches.
  - Always verify target tiles for buildability and absence of obstructions prior to entity placement.

• Fuel Management
  - Monitor burner mining drill fuel levels closely and perform refueling operations promptly to maintain continuous operation.
